Must-Have Experience: Climb one of the steep dunes and then ride on a sled back down.

Favorite Trails: Cedar Sink, Mammoth Cave Railroad, Big Hollow, White Oak
Best Time to Go: Fall is best for hiking; the cave is open year-round, and always 54°F.
Where to Stay: Sleep Inn, Comfort Inn, Red Roof Inn
Admission Fee: There is no entrance fee, however, cave tours (required to visit the cave) do charge a fee.
Must-Have Experience: Take the Violet City tour to learn about the interesting history and natural beauty of Mammoth Cave.

Favorite Trails: Big Room, Natural Entrance
Best Time to Go: Visit during summer to see the nightly bat flights; avoid crowds by avoiding holidays.
Where to Stay: Carlsbad Inn, Great Western Inn, Karbani Inn
Admission Fee: $15 per person, valid for 3 days
Must-Have Experience: From April to October, Brazilian free-tailed bats call the cave home. Visit the natural entrance just before sunset to witness their flight from the cave.

Favorite Trails: Boardwalk Loop, River Trail, Fork Swamp, Kingsnake Trail
Best Time to Go: The weather is pleasant year-round; avoid weekends and holidays to avoid crowds.
Where to Stay: Holiday Inn, Hampton Inn, Courtyard, Country Inn, Hampton Inn, Tru
Admission Fee: None
Must-Have Experience: Take a ranger-guided canoe trip through Congaree’s great swamp.

Best Time to Go: Spring and fall bring an astounding number of birds through the islands during migration.
Where to Stay: Garden Key Campground, Seashell Motel & Hostel
Admission Fee: $15 per person, valid for 7 days
Must-Have Experience: Take the Yankee Freedom boat to Garden Key to explore Fort Jefferson and camp overnight.
